Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: The type of entity that is reporting product ionsuch as well string, lease, operator, etc.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: The type of entity that is reporting product ionsuch as well string, lease, operator, etc.
Column Comment.4: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.5: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.6: ALLOCATION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique number assigned to an allocationfactor, allowing them to be versioned over time. This column replaces DATE, whichwas previously part of the primary key for this table.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.8: REFERENCE ACTIVITY: A reference table identifying the type of activity that causedthe movement of fluids to occur such as production, injection, flaring, sales, etc.
Column Comment.9: ALLOCATION FACTOR: A factor that is used in calculations to allocate productionfrom one entity to another.
Column Comment.10: ALLOCATION FACTOR TYPE: The type of allocation factor that is used incalculations to attribute (allocate) a measured movement of fluid to a number ofproduction entities.
Column Comment.11: BUSINESS RULE: The business rule that helps describe the allocation factorcalculation or description.
Column Comment.12: CALCULATED FROM: The method used to derive the allocation factor.
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE ALLOCATION DATE: The date that this allocation factor becomeseffecti ve.
Column Comment.14: ALLOCATION EXPIRY DATE: The date that this allocation factor is no longer ineffect.
Column Comment.15: REFERENCE PERIOD TYPE: A reference table identifying the periods of time.Possible values include DAY, MONTH, YEAR.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Comment about the allocation factor.
Column Comment.19: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.20: REFERENCE VOLUME METHOD: A reference table identifying the type of methodused to determine the volume of fluids moved. Examples would be measured,prorated, engineering study, etc.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
